title: Peterborough
summary: Peterborough (/ˈpiːtərbərə, -ˌbʌrə/ (listen)) is a cathedral city and unitary authority area in Cambridgeshire, England, with a population of 202,110 in 2017.[5] Originally part of Northamptonshire, it became part of Cambridgeshire from 1974. The city is 76 mi (122 km) north of London, on the River Nene which flows into the North Sea 30 mi (48 km) to the north-east. The railway station is an important stop on the East Coast Main Line between London and Edinburgh.
